hypothesis_content.title: Regime-Dependent Pairs Momentum with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When one major crypto (BTC or ETH) shows 4-hour price momentum exceeding the other by >3% with 2x relative volume increase, a momentum pairs trade (long outperformer/short underperformer) will profit over 24 hours, with directionality dependent on market regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In BULL regimes, BTC leads rallies with ETH lagging. In BEAR regimes, ETH shows relative strength as 'higher beta' asset. Volume confirmation separates sustainable momentum from noise. The 4-hour timeframe captures intraday rotations without excessive noise.
entry_conditions: BULL regime: Long BTC/short ETH when BTC 4hr return > ETH by 3% AND BTC volume ratio > 2.0
BEAR regime: Long ETH/short BTC when ETH 4hr return > BTC by 3% AND ETH volume ratio > 2.0
NEUTRAL: Trade both directions based on momentum leader
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Direction-specific failure: BULL regime trades lose when BTC leads, or regime classification doesn't improve performance by >20% vs random entry.
